author: Ben Gao
title: Why doesn't the Compound htdd template need to have the datatypes of the fields?
question:
for other data definitions, Enumeration, Itemization, we have to state the data type of the field, IE, an itemization, you have to state the datatype, atomic distinct, atomic non-distinct, of each of the cases in the template rules.
so why don't you need to do this with compound data's template rules?
instructor_answer: It’s an unfortunate inconsistency which we intend to fix in the future.
